channel.title: MITB do you like my new car
channel.description:
Yup yup, 1994 Ford Thunderbird LX
[img]http://img268.imageshack.us/img268/4183/2816l4i20.jpg[/img] [img]http://img11.imageshack.us/img11/812/75067a920.jpg[/img]
Just purchased :), 250,000km on the body but it has a rebuilt engine/tranny with 60,000km on it, no rust at all.

item.title: MITB do you like my new car
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

[quote=“Waffendennis, post:49, topic:293811”]A white '96 GTR R33 2.6 RBDETT (Twin turbo).
Almost all my JDM cars are white, the Supra thats comming soon is white too. My Honda Integra Type-R was white too (NH-0 Championship white).
However the Skyline will be gone soon as well. I only got one German car from work, a black Audi nothing fancy.[/quote]

Oh shit. I have a white 2002 Infiniti G20 sport that I swapped an SR20DET into.

Read full topic
item.source: MITB do you like my new car

item.title: MITB do you like my new car
item.dc:creator: @Waffendennis Waffendennis
item.description:
@Waffendennis wrote:

[quote=“RXVL, post:46, topic:293811”][quote author=Waffendennis link=topic=388721.msg2912009#msg2912009 date=1250158149]
Indeed, as long as you perform the shift flawless (without grinding the gears) there is no harm done to the transmission. It’s even easier if you got a ‘dogbox’ like I got in my Skyline.
[/quote]

You have a skyline? 0.o what kind?

Nice car. Shoulda got a manual tranny tho :p, I have to agree with everyone else.[/quote]

A white '96 GTR R33 2.6 RBDETT (Twin turbo).
Almost all my JDM cars are white, the Supra thats comming soon is white too. My Honda Integra Type-R was white too (NH-0 Championship white).
However the Skyline will be gone soon as well. I only got one German car from work, a black Audi nothing fancy.

Read full topic

item.title: MITB do you like my new car
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

In the Netherlands we can’t switch between manual and automatic cars. If we get our license in an automatic car, we can’t drive a manual for a few years IIRC. So almost everyone drives a manual.

Read full topic

It least you’ll have something that will last you 300’000 + miles if you use synthetic oil and do all scheduled mantaince and dont drive it like a fucking nut.

item.title: MITB do you like my new car
item.dc:creator: @Waffendennis Waffendennis
item.description:
@Waffendennis wrote:

For all the people that say you can’t change gears without using your clutch…
You are wrong!

It’s kinda like the double clutch method/ rev match method I tend to use on the track.

If you are experienced you can change the gears without grinding them.

The trick is to make sure the revs match the following gear. And be sure to shift fast enough so that the transmission speed isn’t lower than the engine speed.
As soon as you hit the shifting point ease off the accelerator pedal.
Move your shifter out of gear and put it in the next gear while you let off the accelerator.
Voila, you just shifted without using your clutch!

For the kinds that want to know what double clutch method is:

For example you’re aprroaching a third gear corner, and you’re in 4th.
You depress the clutch, asoon as you hit neutral you let the pedal out halfway and shift to the third gear, as soon you’re near third you fully let out the pedal and put it in third gear.

Rev matching is just matching up the gearbox speed with the engine speed, or vice versa.

Read full topic
item.source: MITB do you like my new car

item.title: MITB do you like my new car
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

I guess this car is not too bad although I don’t like the interior at all. The steering wheel looks very uncomfortable. It reminds me of my dad’s old Mazda Metro.

Uriko:

I don’t want to learn manual now because I still have to take my road test, and if I just bought a manual and learned in this car I might make more mistakes, I’m comfortable with automatic right now.

By the way, don’t be forced to learn Manual at the moment just because people on the forum say so and just stick with what you’re comfortable with being Automatic as you said.

Read full topic
item.source: MITB do you like my new car
